Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it does not correctly calculate the number of small bars to use. It simply returns the remainder of the goal divided by 5, which is not always the correct number of small bars to use. The perfect code, on the other hand, first tries to use as many big bars as possible, then uses small bars to make up the difference. If it can't make up the difference, it returns -1. Generated Test cases 1-18 should pass the buggy code, while all 25 test cases should pass the perfect code.
